moves.1. e4: I started normally, expecting another boring beginning.
moves.1... e6: His move was very different to any I had expected, so I was getting ready for a fun and intersting game!
moves.2. d4: As we are usually taaught, I took the oppurtunity to take control of the center of the board.
moves.2... d5: He challenged me to a pawn swap but I didn't really want to let him get his queen out there so quickly. Now I had to think of a way to avoid this happening.
moves.3. e5: I ended up doing this, which proved to be very helpful for later. At that moment I was thinking that by doing that I had managed to prevent urgo from getting his knight easily to f6.
moves.3... Bd7: Now urgo was trying to advance his bishop, I decided that wanted to castle  on the queen's side, so I was deciding on either advancing my knight or bishop.
moves.4. Be3: Obviously, I chose bishop, as I didn't want his bishop pinning my knight if I were to move it to c3 and I didn't want to move my knight to d2, as that would trap my bishop.
moves.4... Nc6: I guess urgo was simply advancing his pieces to get himself into a good position.
moves.5. Nf3: I decided that I may aswell advance my knight to give me more power around the center of the board.
moves.5... f6: When he did that, realised he wanted me to take his pawn so that he would be able to advance his knight.
moves.6. Bf4: To avoid taking his pawn I developed the pawn's protection by adding a bishop, which would be quite useful in the exchange.
moves.6... g5: When he did that, I noticed an oppurtunity to get a pawn up on him, unless he wanted to be checkmated.
moves.7. Nxg5: I took the pawn because I had realised that if he took my knight, I would have a three move forced checkmate.
moves.7... fxg5: Unfortunately, urgo didn't realise that and fell for my trap. Now the fun began!
moves.8. Qh5+: His only option was to move his king forwards.
moves.8... Ke7: Now I was happy that I had earlier moved my pawn to e5 as his king wouldn't have been able to escape down their now.
moves.9... Nf6: Helplessly, realising his mistake, urgo did the only move possible, preparing for the inevitable.
moves.10. Bxf6#: In just 9 moves I had beaten urgo, which is probably my quickest win!!
